result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Devon D Wilks

records.addlTxt: Pretrial Services Status Report 10-31-22, filed.

Defendant Devon D Wilks in court.  Attorney Russell J. A. Jones appeared by video for Devon D Wilks.  Attorney Abby Rockendorf in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Scheduling conference.  State does not make any motion as to bail.  Defendant is ordered to provide proof of job to Justice Point within the next 24 hours.  Court sets this matter for final pretrial and jury trial dates.  Case adjourned to Br. 9.
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for February 27, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 10-27-22, filed.

Defendant Devon D Wilks in court.  Attorney Russell J. A. Jones in court for Devon D Wilks.  Prosecuting attorney Annie Louk for Abby Rockendorf in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Scheduling conference.  Defense has received discovery and an offer from the State.  Case adjourned to tag-along with co-Defendant case, 22CF1473.  Court addresses recent Justice Point violation. Court gave the defendant a verbal admonishment.  Defendant ordered to appear at next appointment with Justice Point.  Attorney Jones approved to appear via zoom for the next hearing. 
Defendant is ordered to appear in person. Case adjourned to Br. 9. Scheduling conference scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 10-14-22, filed.
Pretrial Services Violation Report 10-13-22, filed.
Affidavit and order for payment of attorney fees and costs due from Milwaukee County signed.  Filed by:    JOSEPH T DOMASK  $650.00
Signed and Filed:  Order for Payment of Attorney Fees and Costs Due from Milwaukee County.

3:19 PM Defendant Devon D Wilks in court.  Attorney Russell J. A. Jones appeared by video for Devon D Wilks.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Stipulation to the identification of the defendant is agreed upon by the parties and approved by the court.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: West Allis Officer J. Maxwell. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 09.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pretrial Services Violation Report 09-22-2022, filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER to Justice Point for LEVEL 5 SUPERVISION.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.  The Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription. The Court ordered defendant to undergo random urine screens, drug tests and breathalyzer test. No possession of firearms or dangerous weapons.

Defendant Devon D Wilks in court.  Attorney Russell J. A. Jones appeared by video for Devon D Wilks.  Prosecuting attorney Patrick T. Franken in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Initial Appearance.  Matter to be set for Preliminary Hearing.  State's motion on bail heard and argued.  The Court reduces bail to $5,000.00, with turnover to Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision, with conditions.  Court orders $3.000.00 returned to the party who posted same.  Case adjourned to Br PE.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Matter held off the record.  Attorney Russell Jones was recently retained by the defendant and is unable to appear for today's hearing due to prior scheduled trial in another matter.  There is the need for an initial appearance and preliminary hearing to be held. Br 9 will hear this matter for initial appearance. Case adjourned to Br. 9.
Initial appearance scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 11:30 am.
/for Defendant, filed.
/signed and filed.

Defendant Devon D Wilks in court.  Alexander C. Dyer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Status of counsel.  Defendant advises the court he has been attempting to retain counsel.  Case is passed to allow Defendant time to speak with an attorney appearing before this Court.

CASE RECALLED 11:12 am
Appearance remain the same.  Attorney Joseph Domask appears as friend of the court.

The Court appoints Joseph Domask as counsel for defendant at the rate of $100.00 per hour at County expense.  Attorney Domask accepts appointment.  The court may require reimburse to Milwaukee County at a later date. Case sets adjourned status of Counsel hearing to allow time for counsel to obtain all discovery and to meet and discuss the case with defendant. Case adjourned to Br. 9.  Status Conference scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 10:30 a.m.

Defendant Devon D Wilks not in court, defendant in custody.  Alexander C. Dyer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for return on warrant.  Bench warrant issued due to Defendant's non-appearance at prior hearing. Defendant was remanded to Br. 9 on his own will and taken into custody.
Court VACATES the Bench Warrant issued and schedules this for further hearing.
Case adjourned to Br. 9 for status of counsel hearing.  Status conference scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 10:30 am.
/signed and filed.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE, BRANCH 9, ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant Devon D Wilks not in court.  Alexander C. Dyer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.   COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE, BR 9, ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.
DECLINATION REASON: This document was mistakenly filed as a proposed order for the court's consideration/signature. The court does not sign motions.
Order for Attorney Mark S. Tishberg to withdraw as counsel.  Signed and Filed.  nk

Defendant Devon D Wilks in court with attorney Mark Stuart Tishberg.  Alexander C. Dyer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for adjourned initial appearance.  Defendant does not want to be represented by defense counsel Mark Stuart Tishberg, and wants to hire his own attorney.  Attorney Tishberg filed Notice of Motion and Motion to Withdraw as Counsel.  Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court.  Case is scheduled for status of counsel.  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case is assigned to branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse.  Status hearing scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

Defendant Devon D Wilks in court with attorney Mark Stuart Tishberg.  Patrick T. Franken appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is in gallery, appeared late. Court addresses possible conflict of interest with co-defendant's case. Case is adjourned in Branch 17.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Case has been added to Judge Stark's calendar to address co-defendant issues and initial appearance.

Defendant Devon D Wilks in court with attorney Amanda M. Parent appeared as a friend of the court.  Alexander C. Dyer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant requested additional time to retain Attorney Mark Tishberg. Commissioner adjourned case back to Out of Custody Court, Safety Building Room 221.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Notice of Retainer

Adjustment Number: 22A 050590,
Payable Number: 1009723,
Receipt Number: 22RP021792,
Amount: $20.00
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 6/8/22 @ 2:30p

Actual Date Bond Posted with *Sheriff
04-15-2022

04-15-2022
Defendant out of custody.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
